title: 103_hr171
content: Section 1 amends the Internal Revenue Code to terminate the designation of income tax payments to the Presidential Election Campaign Fund after December 31, 1991. Section 2 introduces a new part allowing taxpayers to designate overpayments and contributions for the reduction of the public debt. Individual taxpayers can designate a portion of their overpayment of tax and any cash contribution to reduce the public debt when filing their tax return. This designation must be made at the time of filing and in the manner prescribed by the Secretary. Overpayments are treated as refunded for this purpose. The taxpayer's signature is required for overpayments of tax to be treated as refunded. The Secretary of the Treasury transfers overpayments of tax to a special account to reduce the public debt. Taxpayers can make additional contributions to reduce the public debt by sending them to the address provided on tax returns. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 designations apply to contributions made to the United States. A clerical amendment is made to the table of parts for subchapter A of chapter 61. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 1991. Individuals who do not itemize deductions are allowed a deduction for contributions to reduce public debt. Individuals who do not itemize deductions can deduct contributions to reduce public debt. This amendment applies to taxable years starting after December 31, 1991. The amendment allows individuals who do not itemize deductions to deduct contributions for public debt reduction. This applies to taxable years starting after December 31, 1991. The amendment allows individuals to deduct contributions for public debt reduction as a direct public debt reduction contribution for taxable years beginning after December 31, 1992.
